item.description:
Mount Major is a mountain located in Alton, New Hampshire, south of Lake Winnipesaukeeand northeast of Straightback Mountain of the Belknap Range.

The scenic, rocky summit is a popular hiking destination, accessible by multiple trails including the Mount Major Trail, the Brook Trail, and the Boulder Loop.

The north, east and south faces of Mount Major drain into Lake Winnipesaukee, thence via the Winnipesaukee River into the Merrimack River and finally into the Gulf of Maine inMassachusetts. The west ridge of Mount Major rises only 186 feet (57 m) feet above the colwith the higher Straightback Mountain.

This is a loop hike up to Mount Major where there are fantastic views of Lake Winnipesaukee. The hike ascends via Boulder Loop Trail and descends on Major-Straightback Link, Brook Trail, and Mount Major Trail.

cross posted with the New England Hiking Meetup
